sentences: Gábor Darvas (pronounced [ˈɡaːbor ˈdɒrvɒʃ]; until 1952 Gábor Steinberger; 18 January 1911 – 18 February 1985) was a Hungarian composer and musicologist.

He was a direct assistant of Erich Kleiber, In 1948 he returned to Hungary, where he has continued his composer activity in 1951, commencing  an active career as a composer, writing film scores as well as pieces using tape.
Medália (Medal) on a poem by Attila József (1965) for soprano, keyboard instruments, percussion and loudspeaker
Rotation for 5 (1967) for vibraphon, marimba, guitarre, cimbalom and piano
Magánzárka (Solitary confinement) (1970) for percussion and tape
Bánat (Grief) on a poem by Gábor Karinthy (1978) for baritone, orchestra and tape
Fantázia (Phantasy) (1983) for piano and chamber ensemble
